articles.headline: Kamala Harris Says She’s Still ‘in This Fight,’ but Out of the 2020 Race
articles.snippet: The California senator broke barriers but ran out of money as she struggled in polls. Her abrupt announcement is perhaps the most surprising development to date in the 2020 race.
articles.abstract: The California senator broke barriers but ran out of money as she struggled in polls. Her abrupt announcement is perhaps the most surprising development to date in the 2020 race.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Kamala Harris of California dropped out of the Democratic presidential race on Tuesday after months of low poll numbers and a series of missteps that crippled her campaign, a deflating comedown for a barrier-breaking candidate who was seeking to become the first black woman to win a major party’s presidential nomination.
articles.byline: By Astead W. Herndon, Shane Goldmacher and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Impeachment Report Says Trump Solicited Foreign Election Interference
articles.snippet: The House Intelligence Committee concluded that President Trump tried to “use the powers of his office to solicit foreign interference on his behalf in the 2020 election.”
articles.abstract: The House Intelligence Committee concluded that President Trump tried to “use the powers of his office to solicit foreign interference on his behalf in the 2020 election.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Tuesday asserted that President Trump abused his power by pressuring Ukraine to help him in the 2020 presidential election, releasing an impeachment report that found the president “placed his own personal and political interests above the national interests of the United States.”
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: For Trump and Europe, a Surprising Role Reversal
articles.snippet: Where the president once kept European leaders off balance, Europe’s shifting landscape now has the Great Disrupter scrambling to recalibrate his approach.
articles.abstract: Where the president once kept European leaders off balance, Europe’s shifting landscape now has the Great Disrupter scrambling to recalibrate his approach.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — President Trump has always relished throwing European leaders off balance, antagonizing allies, embracing insurgents and setting off a frantic contest for how best to deal with him. Now, as Europe undergoes dizzying political changes of its own, it is throwing Mr. Trump off balance.

articles.headline: Hemp Industry Is Cleared to Do Business With Banks
articles.snippet: United States regulators say hemp businesses should not be treated with any more suspicion than other bank customers.
articles.abstract: United States regulators say hemp businesses should not be treated with any more suspicion than other bank customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The number of banks in the United States willing to lend to hemp producers can be counted on one hand. That is about to change.

articles.headline: Era Ends for Google as Founders Step Aside From a Pillar of Tech
articles.snippet: Sundar Pichai, who has run Google for several years, is taking the reins from Larry Page as Alphabet’s C.E.O.
articles.abstract: Sundar Pichai, who has run Google for several years, is taking the reins from Larry Page as Alphabet’s C.E.O.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Larry Page and Sergey Brin, the Stanford graduate students who founded Google over two decades ago, are stepping down from executive roles at Google’s parent company, Alphabet, they announced on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: Trump Inflames the Trade Wars, Again
articles.snippet: In a series of moves and comments, the president has stirred new turmoil into financial markets and the global economy.
articles.abstract: In a series of moves and comments, the president has stirred new turmoil into financial markets and the global economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — President Trump left the global economy unsettled on Tuesday when he threatened NATO allies and suggested that he could wait a year to reach a trade agreement with China, sending stock markets swooning.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers, Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: How Huawei Lost the Heart of the Chinese Public
articles.snippet: When an executive wrote about her house arrest in Canada, an outcry about a former employee’s treatment arose on social media.
articles.abstract: When an executive wrote about her house arrest in Canada, an outcry about a former employee’s treatment arose on social media.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the first anniversary of her arrest in Canada, Meng Wanzhou, the chief financial officer of the Chinese telecom giant Huawei, issued an open letter describing how she experienced fear, pain, disappointment, helplessness, torment and acceptance of the unknown.

articles.headline: Hundreds of Thousands Are Losing Access to Food Stamps
articles.snippet: The Agriculture Department gave its final approval to the first of three rules that are ultimately expected to cut more than three million from the food stamp rolls.
articles.abstract: The Agriculture Department gave its final approval to the first of three rules that are ultimately expected to cut more than three million from the food stamp rolls.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration, brushing aside tens of thousands of protest letters, gave final approval on Wednesday to a rule that will remove nearly 700,000 people from the federal food-stamp program by strictly enforcing federal work requirements.
